name: SULFINPYRAZONE
breadcrumbs: 10.1 Drugs used in rheumatic diseases and gout
cautions:
Cautions see under Probenecid; regular blood counts advisable; cardiac disease (may cause salt and
water retention); interactions: Appendix 1 (sulfinpyrazone)
side-effects:
Side-effects gastro-intestinal disturbances, occasionally allergic
skin reactions, salt and water retention; rarely blood disorders,
gastro-intestinal ulceration and bleeding, acute renal failure, raised
liver enzymes, jaundice and hepatitis
doses:
Initially 100–200 mg daily with food (or milk) increasing
over 2–3 weeks to 600 mg daily (rarely 800 mg daily), continued until
serum uric acid concentration normal then reduced for maintenance
(maintenance dose may be as low as 200 mg daily)
pregnancy: Pregnancy manufacturer advises caution—no information available
